intro: Chersydrium, commonly known as the gum tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Myrtaceae. These plants are native to Australia and are characterized by their aromatic leaves and showy flowers. Chersydrium species typically have rough, fissured bark and produce a sticky resin, which gives them their common name. They are often found in dry, sandy soils and are adapted to arid environments. The genus includes several species, such as Chersydrium baccatum, which is notable for its edible fruits.
